comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: We're looking for your help! Please help us identify the location in this photograph in the comments below.

comment.author: 20496922@N00
comment._content:
E St. NW between 13th and 14th NW, looking north. In the foreground is what is now "Freedom Plaza."  The buildings visible in this picture have all been demolished.

The tall white structure is the The Munsey Building, built in 1905 and demolished in 1980.

The Romanesque Revival building on the left is the Washington Post Building.

Just outside the shot on the left would be the Willard Hotel.

On the right of the Munsey Building, obscured by the trees, is the National Theater, which occupies the same spot today.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Such wonderful details, "grits'n collards, friend to all". Thanks for all your help!

Susannah
Smithsonian Institution Archives
